title: Lloyds condemned after rigging cost of Bank of England rescue scheme - as it happened | Business | The Guardian
summary: mark garnier mp : people will be very angry about lloyds ' rigging .
andrew tyrie mp : lloyds behaviour is appalling .
lloyds fined for manipulating special liquidity scheme fees .
mark carney : lloyds manipulation may amount to criminal conduct .
bank of england : lloyds ' conduct is 'highly reprehensible and clearly unlawful '
lloyds banking group fined £ 218m over libor .
russia ordered to pay $ 50bn to yukos investors .

documents.title: lloyds suspends staff
text: we 've also learned tonight that lloyds has suspended seven staff over the conduct that led to today 's £ 218m fines .

my colleague jill treanor reports : among those suspended by lloyds on monday were three of the four unnamed individuals cited by the fca who may have been involved in depriving the bank of england of emergency funding fees of almost £ 8m .

a total of 22 people are understood to be bound up in the latest regulatory crack-down on benchmark manipulation ; six had already been suspended before monday and the rest have already left the bank .
their identities are not revealed in a series of damning emails and electronic chats released by regulators as they handed out fines .
instead the individuals are referred to as `` manager a '' or `` trader b '' .
more here , including details of those messages : lloyds suspends seven people after £ 226m bill for rigging interest rates

documents.title: nils pratley : a pure case of lloyds biting the hand that feeds it
text: our financial editor , nils pratley , identifies one of the odd elements of lloyds ' ripping off of the bank of england : the fact of a fiddle against the bank is astonishing and the motivation bewildering .
libor-rigging was understandable in that it was all about personal greed ; a few fractions of a percentage point could benefit a trading book and thus produce a bigger end-of-year bonus .
by contrast , no personal gain was possible by manipulating sls submissions because any benefit would accrue to their employer only .
the traders appear to have been fuelled by resentment .
it `` just keeps going up and up does n't it ? ''
grumbled one bank of scotland trader about the sls bill , ignoring the fact that his bank would have gone bust without state support .
a purer case of biting the hand that feeds is hard to imagine .
here 's his full comment piece : lloyds repo men default on the moral payments

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: that 's a good moment to recap .

lloyds banking group has been blasted by the bank of england after being fined for rigging financial benchmarks , including one used to assess the cost of a liquidity scheme designed to save the banking system .
and those responsible face the threat of legal action , with mps expressing shock that taxpayers could have lost out again .
it 's the latest scandal to hit the city - and the first time that a bank has been fined for rigging the cost of the special liquidity scheme , which helped uk banks keep afloat in the crisis .
bank governor mark carney has warned that the manipulation of the sls was 'clearly unlawful ' , and could constitute criminal action .

he told lloyds in a letter that : in view of the seriousness of this matter , the pra [ prudential regulation authority ] will consider whether further action should be taken in relation to the firms or individuals at the firms .
lloyds has agreed that the behaviour was unacceptable and `` truly shocking conduct '' .
it has been fined £ 218m by regulators on both sides of the atlantic .
it will also pay almost £ 8m in compensation to the boe .
city regulators hit lloyds with a £ 105m fine ; £ 70m for reporting false information to the boe , and £ 35m for failings related to the libor scandal .
andrew tyrie , head of the treasury committee of parliament , said the bank 's actions were `` appalling '' , and a reminder of the need to reform britain 's financial sector .
a total of 15 staff were involved in the libor and sls cases - they 've all either left lloyds or now face disciplinary action .

transcripts released by regulators showed that staff conspired to fix libor , with one saying that , like tesco 's , `` every little helped '' i 'll try to update the blog with any more key developments this evening otherwise , keep watching the website for further developments .
thanks .
gw from black horse to black sheep devlin/pa

documents.title: mark garnier mp : people will be very angry about lloyds ' rigging
text: another influential mp has gone public with his concerns over lloyds .
mark garnier , a member of the treasury committee , said the case is `` really alarming '' , and suggested that committee may take a close look at lloyds .
this is , on the face of it , a deliberate action to defraud the taxpayer .
we will need to look at what exactly has been going on .
people will be very angry about it and rightly so . ''
( quotes via reuters )
the financial times mark odell has collected together some of the messages shared between lloyds staff while manipulating libor .

here 's one : in july 19 , 2007 , a lloyds manager was informed by a lloyds trader about a request made to another lloyds trader for a low rate , the trader commented : every little helps it 's like tescos '' .
and another : on august 17 2007 , lloyds trader a called broker a saying : i ai n't got any 3s fixings mate .
i 've got no fixings today .
so i can do my libors wherever i f want to put them , mate . ''
more here .

over in america , assistant us attorney general leslie caldwell reminds of why manipulating financial benchmarks is so serious : `` because investors and consumers rely on libor 's integrity , rate-rigging fundamentally undermines confidence in financial markets , ''

documents.title: andrew tyrie mp : lloyds behaviour is appalling
text: andrew tyrie , chairman of the treasury committee .
clay for the guardian more condemnation is raining down on lloyds - this time from andrew tyrie mp , chairman of the treasury committee , who says the behaviour exposed today was `` appalling ' .
tyrie , who also chaired the parliamentary commission on banking standards , said lloyds ' case is a reminder of the misconduct that triggered that inquiry .
tyrie says : the banks were manipulating libor and the repo rate , in the process deceiving the bank of england in its operation of a taxpayer-backed support scheme .
it was appalling behaviour like this that triggered the creation of the parliamentary commission on banking standards .

one of the central recommendations of the commission was to ensure that individuals carry responsibility for their decisions and behaviour , and that they will be held accountable when they rig markets .
this settlement is part of the much needed clean-up operation .
implementing the commission 's proposals will be another . ''

documents.title: libor : two years of fines
text: when the first libor fines were imposed in the summer of 2012 , there was palpable shock that traders had conspired to rig a benchmark interest rate by misreporting their borrowing costs .
two years on , and there 's little surprise that another bunch of city workers apparently did n't understand , or care , about how markets should work .

pa has a timeline of how the libor fines have landed in the uk : barclays was the first to settle rate-rigging claims , paying £ 290 million in penalties to us and uk regulators in june 2012 - in a scandal which precipitated the resignation of chief executive bob diamond .
this was followed by £ 940 million in fines for swiss bank ubs six months later .

state-backed royal bank of scotland was hit with a £ 391 million pay-out while there were penalties of £ 54 million for city broker icap a £ 663 million payout for dutch lender rabobank last october included pay-outs to authorities in the us , uk and the netherlands .
in may this year , city broker rp martin was fined £ 1.3 million by us and uk regulators .
the headquarters of dutch co-operative bank rabobank in utrecht .
van lieshout/afp/getty images
as well as being thoroughly reprehensible , diddling the bank of england out of the full cost of its liquidity scheme did n't even make financial sense for lloyds .
british banks paid a total of £ 2.6bn to access the special liquidity scheme in 2008 and 2009 , with lloyds responsible for almost half of those fees .
it 's fiddling of the repo rate that was used to calculate the sls 's fees cost the boe almost £ 8m , suggesting lloyds only saved around £ 4m - or 0.3 % of its total bill .
and of course , it 's now repaying the £ 8m to the boe , plus £ 70m in fines .
lloyds share price is remarkably unscathed by today 's revelations , trading virtually unchanged at 74.82p this afternoon .

the libor fine should be 'priced in ' ( we 've known for weeks that it was due soon ) , but the manipulation of the cost of the bank of england 's rescue scheme is an unwelcome new development , that could cause lloyds some reputational damage .

the bbc 's robert peston shares our shock at the revelation that lloyds staff deceived the bank of england when signing up for its liquidity scheme : robert peston ( @ peston ) the disclosure that lloyds ripped off bank of england on the sls rescue scheme , which stopped lloyds going bust , is jaw dropping
sky news is reporting that nine former lloyds employees now face criminal charges in the us , in their story on today 's fines : lloyds risks criminal action for fee-fixing

documents.title: our story : bank of england blasts lloyds for rigging bailout funding
text: here 's our news story on lloyds ' fines , and the bank of england 's furious reaction to its misconduct , by city editor jill treanor : bank of england blasts lloyds for rigging bailout funding the libor-rigging scandal took a new twist on monday when lloyds banking group faced accusations of unlawful behaviour after being ordered pay compensation to the bank of england for manipulating the fees it paid for emergency funding during the height of the banking crisis .
in addition to £ 218m of fines from regulators in the uk and us for rigging the benchmark rate , the 24 % taxpayer-owned bank was ordered to pay threadneedle street nearly £ 8m .
the fines imposed on lloyds cover two main issues - manipulating libor , for which seven other firms have been punished - and , for the first time , rigging another rate , known as the repo rate .

this repo rate was used to calculate the scale of the fees paid to the bank of england for its special liquidity scheme ( sls ) which was created to pump money into the financial system amid fears banks were facing a credit crisis .
the bank of england said lloyds ' manipulation of the repo rate was `` highly reprehensible and clearly unlawful '' full story here .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) bank of england blasts lloyds for rigging bailout funding

documents.title: mark carney : lloyds manipulation may amount to criminal conduct .
text: the bank of england has just released an exchange of letters between governor mark mark carney and lloyds chairman lord blackwell earlier this month , ahead of today 's fines .

in his letter , carney expresses that bank 's clear outrage that lloyds tried to manipulate the cost of the special liquidity scheme scheme that was designed to rescue it ( details here ) , of england carney writes : such manipulation is highly reprehensible , clearly unlawful and may amount to criminal conduct on the part of the individuals involved .
it reduced not only the amount of fees payable by the firms but also the fees payable by other firms using the sls .
the bank 's calculations show that the total reduction in fees received by the bank may have been as high as £ 7.76 million .
please confirm that the firms accept liability and will compensate the bank accordingly .
the bank 's chief legal adviser will separately contact your general counsel .
in view of the seriousness of this matter , the pra will consider whether further action should be taken in relation to the firms or individuals at the firms .
in reply , lord blackwell said he `` absolutely shared '' the bank 's concerns over the sls conduct , especially the implication that this reduced fees paid by all banks .
he writes : this was truly shocking conduct , undertaken when the bank was on a lifeline of public support .
blackwell confirmed that lloyds will forward the £ 7.76m compensation `` as soon as convenient . ''
if not sooner , i 'd suggest .
as with previous cases , lloyds staff have been remarkable indiscreet when discussing about how to fix libor rates .
one trader even quoted tesco 's famous maxim `` every little helps '' when agreeing to assist .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) july 2007 : lloyds trader on being asked for a low libor fix `` every little helpsit 's like tescos ''
lloyds says that all the individuals involved have either left the group , been suspended or are subject to disciplinary proceedings .
so , how many lloyds staff were involved ?
according to the fca , four individuals manipulated the repo rate to drive down the cost of the special liquidity scheme - two at lloyds banking group and two at bank of scotland .
and sixteen individuals at the firms , were involved in the libor failings - including one manager who was also caught up in the sls manipulation .

documents.title: how lloyds broke the rules on libor
text: lloyds staff broke the rules regarding the libor benchmark ( at which banks would lend to each other ) in several ways .
that includes `` colluding '' with dutch bank rabobank to change the yen libor rate , to benefit both firms ' trading positions .
and bank of scotland staff also manipulated their submissions for gbp and us dollar libor , on a manager 's orders .
the fca says this was done to avoid `` negative media comment and market perception in respect of its financial stability during the financial crisis '' .
back in 2008 , investors and journalists were watching the libor rate closely to see whether banks had lost confidence in each other .
lloyds has issued a statement , saying it `` condemns '' the actions of the individuals responsible for manipulating the sls fees , and for libor failings .

lord blackwell , lloyds banking group 's chairman , insisted that only a small number of staff were involved : `` the board regards the actions of these individuals between 2006 and 2009 as completely unacceptable .
their behaviour involved a gross breach of trust and we condemn it without reservation .
i have written to the governor of the bank of england to make clear we have a common view on this .

i am also convinced that it is entirely unrepresentative of the vast majority of our staff who are committed to delivering outstanding service and doing the right thing for customers , recognising that trust is at the core of our business . ''

documents.title: bank of england : lloyds ' conduct is 'highly reprehensible and clearly unlawful '
text: the bank of england has issued a blistering statement on the news that lloyds has been fined £ 70m for rigging the cost of its special liquidity scheme .
the boe points out that taxpayers lost out , especially as the actions of lloyds staff meant that other banks also paid lower fees for taking part in the sls .
the boe says : the bank put the sls in place to help banks get through the worst of the financial crisis .

the fact that lloyds and bank of scotland , the largest beneficiaries of this assistance , manipulated their three month gbp repo rate submissions in order to reduce fees is highly reprehensible and clearly unlawful .
not only were fees payable by lloyds and bank of scotland reduced as a result of this conduct , so too were fees payable by other firms using the sls .
the compensation payment takes this fully into account .

- lloyds staff did this by manipulating their submissions for the `` repo rate '' submissions , which showed the prices they 'd pay to trade in the repo market - which lets firms swap assets for cash .

documents.title: lloyds fined for manipulating special liquidity scheme fees
text: this is remarkable .
lloyds is also being fined for attempting to manipulate the fees payable to the bank of england for the firms ' participation in the special liquidity scheme ( sls ) .
the sls was the taxpayer-backed government scheme set up to save britain 's banks during the height of the financial crisis , by encouraging them to lend .
but lloyds traders , we now learn , decided to manipulate the `` repo rate benchmark '' , to lower the fees they would have to pay to the bank of england for participation in the sls .
a large slice of lloyds ' fine from the fca ( £ 70m of the £ 105m total ) is for this offence .
the fca says it 's `` an extremely serious failing '' .
tracey mcdermott , the fca 's director of enforcement and financial crime , said : the firms were a significant beneficiary of financial assistance from the bank of england through the sls .
colluding to benefit the firms at the expense , ultimately , of the uk taxpayer was unacceptable .
this falls well short of the standards the fca and the market is entitled to expect from regulated firms lloyds is paying £ 7.76 million compensation to the bank of england for this misconduct .
i believe this the first time that a uk bank has been fined for this sort of misconduct - biting the hand that was feeding them the emergency funding they needed to keep running .
the full statement is here .

documents.title: lloyds banking group fined £ 218m over libor
text: news is breaking that lloyds banking group has been fined more than £ 200m for failings related to key financial benchmarks , including libor .
the bank , 24 % owned by the taxpayer , has just become the latest bank to be punished over the libor scandal , in which traders conspired to fix benchmark interest rates .
lloyds been fined by the city watchdog , the financial conduct authority , as well as us regulators .
the fca has fined lloyds £ 105m for `` serious libor failings , and 'other benchmark failings '' .
america 's cftc has charged lloyds with manipulation , attempted manipulation and false reporting of libor , and hit it with a $ 105m civil penalty .
and the us department of justice is fining lloyds a further $ 86m .
we make that a grand total of £ 218m , or $ 370m more details , and reaction , to follow rain/epa
the financial times has pulled together a short q & a on the yukos court ruling : here 's a flavour : will russia pay ?
the award is final and binding and therefore can not be appealed .
however , moscow has already said that it plans to exhaust all legal avenues to protect its interests and it can appeal to a dutch court to overturn the judgment .
while the outcome of such a so-called setting aside '' motion would be unclear , it could delay enforcement of the award .

if the russian government still refuses to pay following a final ruling , the plaintiffs would have to pursue russian assets , which could be anything that belongs to the russian state overseas , through national courts in other countries to satisfy their claim .
this would be a lengthy and complex process .
certain kinds of state assets , including central bank reserves as well as diplomatic and military property , are protected by state immunity .

documents.title: sanctions threat looms over moscow
text: the landmark yukos court ruling comes as russian companies brace for further economic sanctions .

brussels is due to announce details of its crackdown on tuesday , and that - rather than events in the hague - is the number one issue for moscow , says denis poryvai , an analyst at raiffeisen bank .

poryvai told reuters : `` against the background of the sanctions that the eu is mulling against russia this week , ( the court decision ) is secondary news for the market , '' and that market is still down around 2 % today .
so what might these new sanctions entail ?
well , the eu agreed in principle to implement new restrictions 10 days ago , the day before the malaysia airline 's mh17 crashed in ukraine .

that tragedy has hardened europe 's resolve , despite worries about gas supplies analysts at eurasia group think ministers will agree to sanction elements of russia 's finance , defense and energy sectors .
the us , which has announced measures against banks and oil companies already , is likely to take further steps too .
and russia is likely to retaliate .
eurasia say : most likely , russia will suspend observance of a major arms control treaty , such as start .
in addition , russia will apply at least informal retaliation against us companies , impairing their operations through health and safety inspections and customs delays .
this process has already begun against mcdonalds .
shares in rosneft , which bought many of yukos 's assets a decade ago , have fallen almost 2.8 % today following the court ruling .
rosneft shares have now fallen 14 % since the end of june , as the geopolitical crisis over ukraine escalated .
the main moscow stock market , the micex composite index , is down 2 % today .

here 's one of the many assets which yukos lost when it collapsed a decade ago under the weight of moscow 's tax demands : a yuganskneftegaz pumping station , formerly owned by russian oil giant yukos , in priobskoe oilfield , some 200 km from nefteyugansk , russia .
kochetkov/epa yuganskneftegaz is a wholly integrated subsidiary of rosneft .

documents.title: mikhail khodorkovsky : it 's sad that yukos compensation must come from the state 's coffers
text: mikhail khodorkovsky , on a visit to ukraine in march 2014 .
dolzhenko/epa mikhail khodorkovsky , the former boss of yukos , has just issued a statement on today 's court ruling .
in it , he confirms that he is not looking to benefit financially from the case .
and he also points out that the cost of the ruling will fall on the state , not the `` mafiosi '' involved .
khodorkovsky says : it is with a feeling of satisfaction that i have learned about the award by the permanent court of arbitration .
it is the first independent tribunal to have considered the yukos case in its entirety , to have examined the evidence and to have heard witness testimony .

the findings were predictable for any unbiased observer of the disgraceful basmannyi travesty of justice : from beginning to end , the yukos case has been an instance of unabashed plundering of a successful company by a mafia with links to the state .
it is fantastic that the company shareholders are being given a chance to recover their damages .
it is sad that the recompense will have to come from the state 's coffers , not from the pockets of mafiosi linked to the powers that be and those of putin 's oligarchs .
i am taking this opportunity to confirm that i am not a party to these legal proceedings and i do not seek to benefit financially from their outcome . ''
jason corcoran ( @ jason corcoran ) former yukos boss @ twitterid on hague ruling : `it is with a feeling of satisfaction that i have learned about the award . '

jason corcoran ( @ jason corcoran ) former yukos boss @ twitterid on hague ruling : `it 's sad the recompense will have to come from state 's coffers not from pockets of mafiosi jason corcoran ( @ jason corcoran ) former yukos boss @ twitterid on hague ruling : `i am not a party to legal proceedings and i do n't seek to benefit financially from outcome

over in israel , yukos investor and business magnate leonid nevzlin says he 's 'pleased ' with today 's verdict ( as i guess one would be ) : leonid nevzlin says he 's pleased hague court ruled russia illegally nationalised yukos nevzlin is the biggest beneficiary of today 's ruling , having bought mikhail khodorkovsky 's stake back in 2004 .
russia has 180 days to meet the ruling , according to lawyers representing the yukos shareholders .
after 15 january 2015 , interest will start racking up .
sander wagner ( @ sanderwagner ) just out of interest , what exactly would be the russian state property in other countries yukos could seize if russia does n't pay ?
russia had already pledged to fight the ruling , associated press reports : russian foreign minister sergey lavrov , commenting earlier monday , said russia will be appealing the ruling .
`` authorities who are representing russia in this trial will use all possible legal means to defend their position , '' lavrov said .

yukos 's corporate structure does look rather complex , including a swathe of holding companies and international divisions ( there 's a blurry chart at the end of the ruling ) joseph cotterill ( @ jsphctrl ) also , here 's a yukos company structure from deep within the arbitration rulings .
ruth green ( @ ruthsgreen ) judging by the company 's complex corporate structure , i 'm not surprised the tax structure was complicated at # yukos
i 've just recropped the images in the last entry , so refreshing your browser should make them a little clearer .

documents.title: how the $ 50bn figure was reached
text: having made its ruling , the permanent court had to determine a fair value for yukos 's assets today .
it decided that yukos did bear some responsibility for its demise , and cut the total payout by 25 % .
this table , buried at the back of the ruling , outlines the decision to award yukos 's major shareholders over $ 50bn : .
of arbitration ( if it 's hard to read , check out this larger version on the ft )

documents.title: did putin blunder over yukos case ?
text: vladimir putin may have accidentally handed yukos the proof it needed that the sale of its assets to rosneft was politically motivated .

speaking at a press conference in 2004 , the russian president told reporters that the state was `` looking after its own interests '' , having seen valuable assets snaffled on the cheap in russia 's 1990s privatisation drive .
joseph cotterill of the ft highlights the key section ( it 's on page 464 ) .
joseph cotterill ( @ jsphctrl ) from yukos ruling - tribunal ready to accept rosneft was n't acting for russian state then putin himself ruins it

documents.title: the ( rejected ) russian defence
text: in their defence , the russian authorities had insisted that yukos had `` fraudulently evaded billions of dollars of tax '' between 1999 to 2004 , by setting up 'sham trading shells ' in russian regions with lower tax rates .
they accused its oligarch owners of building their investments through `` illegal acts and bad faith '' conduct .

as the russian federation put it ( their case begins on page 34 ) : yukos abused the low-tax region program , and evaded russian corporate profit tax in violation of the bad faith taxpayer doctrine , by implementing what yukos referred to internally as its tax optimization '' scheme .
pursuant to this scheme , yukos established dozens of sham trading companies '' in low-tax regions that had no business purpose , and then shifted its own profits to the sham trading companies .

these sham trading shells had no genuine economic substance and served no purpose other than to reduce yukos ' tax liabilities , an arrangement described by yukos ' own lawyers as constituting unlawful tax evasion .
however , the permanent court of arbitration concluded that russia 's actions went beyond simple tax collection , and was bent on crushing the company .

they say ( on page 255 ) : after having now traversed , at some length , the treatment of yukos by russian tax authorities , the bailiffs and the courts , and having considered the totality of the evidence , especially the vat evidence , the tribunal has concluded that the primary objective of the russian federation was not to collect taxes but rather to bankrupt yukos and appropriate its valuable assets .
today 's ruling has some fascinating detail about the intersection between politics and business in vladimir putin 's russia .
on page 62 , for example , former chief economic advisor andrei illarionov told the court that yukos was `` one of the most dangerous enemies for those who did not want to see russia a free country .
here 's a flavour : according to dr. illarionov , the arrests of messrs. khodorkovsky and [ chief executive ] lebedev and the dismantlement of yukos were politically and economically motivated .
yukos ' intended merger with western oil majors was seen as a national betrayal and a hurdle to expropriation .

dr. illarionov describes the 19 february 2003 meeting at the kremlin between president putin and business leaders , at which mr. khodorkovsky made a presentation on corruption , to which president putin responded that everyone knew how various assets , including yukos , were acquired , and told mr. khodorkovsky : i return the ball in your corner . ''
the tone of the meeting became steely and menacing '' as if something had gone really wrong . ''
five months later , in july 2003 , lebedev was arrested .
khodorkovsky himself was arrested that october , charged with fraud and tax evasion .
tim osborne , director of gml ( the yukos shareholders ) , says : we are thrilled with this decision , although we know it is not the end of the road . ''

that 's via the new york times , which also flags up that the ruling probably wo n't benefit mikhail khodorkovsky himself : it is unlikely mr. khodorkovsky will benefit financially from the verdict , as he contends he handed over his stake to a partner , leonid b. nevzlin , who lives in israel , in 2005 .

documents.title: yukos shareholder press conference underway
text: the victorious yukos investors are holding a press conference in london now .

my colleague jennifer rankin is tweeting from it : jennifer rankin ( @ jennifermerode ) hague court rules against russia in yukos case , seized assets via `` a devious and calculated expropriation '' .
jennifer rankin ( @ jennifermerode ) judgement finds russian courts `` bent to the will '' of russian authorities .
# yukos jennifer rankin ( @ jennifermerode ) yukos compensation ruling could spell trouble for bp , shareholders considering its assets , `` nobody is safe '' says head s-h group .
ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) good day for ousted russian billionaires former yukos s/h wins $ 50bln in damages against russia

documents.title: read the yukos ruling here
text: the court ruling over the yukos case is online here .
it 's over 600 pages long .
the size of the compensation payment comes on page 521 .
tthe tribunal has decided to award claimants post- award interest on the damages of usd 50,020,867,798 for which the tribunal has found respondent liable .
rosneft , which ended up with many of yukos 's energy assets after the company collapsed , is denying that any wrongdoing took place .
it does n't expect to pay any of the $ 50bn compensation claim .
russia 's rosneft says all deals regarding acquisition of yukos assets were legal russia 's rosneft believes that no claims can be made to the company due to the hague court ruling on yukos

reuters is snapping more details of the yukos ruling : russian courts `` bent '' to bankrupt yukos , jail political rival - hague court rosneft officials working for president putin , implemented policies aimed at destroying yukos - court

documents.title: russia ordered to pay $ 50bn to yukos investors
text: the yukos oil company headquarters in moscow , back in 2004 .
korotayev/reuters russia has been ordered to pay $ 50bn to the shareholders in former oil company yukos , to compensate them for the loss of valuable assets a decade ago .
in a blow to moscow , the permanent court of arbitration in the hague has just ruled in favour of five investors including former yukos chief executive , platon lebedev .
it 's one of the biggest arbitration awards ever made against a sovereign state , and comes after a nine-year legal battle .
yukos was created by former oligarch mikhail khodorkovsky , once russia 's richest man .
the company collapsed after being hit with a $ 27bn tax bill , and its oil fields and other assets were sold to another major oil company , rosneft .
khodorkovsky was jailed for ten years ; seen as part of president putin 's crackdown on billionaires with political interests .
former russian oil tycoon mikhail khodorkovsky , speaks during a news conference in donetsk , eastern ukraine , in april 2014 .
ratner/reuters khodorkovsky sold off his own interest in yukos to pay his legal expenses , but this case was brought by the other major investors , who had been seeking $ 100bn .
a evans-pritchard ( @ ambroseep ) yukos award v russia $ 50bn , unanimous ruling , 20 times largest ever arb award in hague running now reaction to follow

documents.title: geopolitics : what the analysts say
text: michael heise , chief economist of fund manager allianz , is worried about the deteriorating relations between russia and the west , saying `` the situation is very dangerous . ''
`` an escalation carries large risks for the economy .
`` there is a big risk from further sanctions although one has to accept that clear ( diplomatic ) signals are needed . ''

kit juckes of societe generale is struck by the financial markets ' refusal to react to the geopolitical tensions dominating the news : if there has been any good news in the ukraine conflict or in gaza i missed it , but while the rubble has weakened somewhat over the last week , even the turkish lira has held up .
that speaks to the dominance of the risk-friendly global backdrop as low us rates and continued , albeit modest global growth trump almost anything else .

stan shamu of ig says investors are still watching ukraine closely : european leaders are reportedly considering further restrictions on russia 's access to capital markets and this is likely to remain a talking point this week .
russia 's micex stock index has dropped by 0.75 % so far today , as the prospect of new sanctions loom over moscow .

documents.title: european market open
text: it 's a somewhat subdued start to trading in europe , where the main stock markets have all risen a little .
in london , the ftse 100 has gained 15 points or 0.25 % , led by consumer giant reckitt benckiser ( +3 % ) which announced plans to spin off its pharmaceuticals arm this morning .
photograph : /thomson reuters germany 's dax is flat , though , reflecting concerns that tougher sanctions on russia could hurt german firms .
shares in ryanair have jumped 5 % in early trading , as traders welcome its raised profit forecasts .

documents.title: ryanair hikes profit forecasts
text: budget airline ryanair has added to the optimism in the markets this morning , by hiking its profit forecasts .
after hitting investors with some nasty profit warnings in 2013 , ceo michael o'leary was on more comfortable ground this morning .
ryanair reported a 152 % jump in net profits in the first three months of this financial year - partly due to the late timing of easter .
it also hiked its profit guidance to €620m-€650m , from €580m-€620m .

o'leary said ryanair 's new bases in athens , brussels , lisbon and rome are `` performing strongly '' , and declared that european airports are falling over each other to get ryanair onside : `` we are overrun with growth offers from primary european airports whose incumbent flag and regional carriers continue to cut capacity and traffic , ''
the nikkei 's rally was also driven by hopes that japanese car makers will report decent earnings this week .
ryota sakagami , chief equity strategist at smbc nikko securities , predicted that the index could `` quickly push toward 16,000 [ points ] , possibly by the end of august . ''

documents.title: japan 's nikkei index hits six-month high
text: japan 's stock market has hit its highest level since late january , driven by economic optimism and the prospect of decent company earnings .
the nikkei has closed at 15529 , up 71 points , a point not reached since late january .
japanese nikkei , in 2014 photograph : /thomson reuters signs that the asian economies are improving drove shares up across the region , led by china , where the shanghai market jumped over 2 % .
overnight , the beijing government announced that profits at china 's industrial companies had soared by 17.9 % last month , compared to june 2103 .
that 's being taken as another sign that mini-stimulus measures implemented in recent months are paying off ( despite ongoing fears that the chinese property market is in trouble ) .
and chinese industrial earnings over the first six months of 2014 have jumped by 11.4 % , a record high .

michael kitchen ( @ kitchennews ) asia late shanghai up 2.4 % hk up 1.1 % nikkei ends 0.5 % up asx down 0.1 % in rolling close taiex ends down 0.2 % sensex down 0.5 % $ nik $ hsi there are also signs that asian traders are more relaxed about the crisis in ukraine .

soichiro monji , chief strategist at daiwa sb investments in tokyo , said : `` geopolitical concerns remain as the conflict in the ukraine does not look like it will end soon , but there is some relief spreading that the impact will be contained , '' ( via reuters ) other analysts are more worried that the markets are too relaxed about geopolitics , though - i '' ll pull a round-up together shortly .

documents.title: pharmaceuticals gripped by spin-off plans
text: a glaxosmithkline logo .
whyld/pa good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and the eurozone .
the pharmaceuticals sector is in focus today , after the boss of glaxosmithkline hinted that he could break up the company .
sir andrew witty told the ft he 's happy to spin off its consumer healthcare business if it would help gsk bounce back from a turbulent year dominated by the chinese bribery scandal .

gsk opens issue of spinning off consumer division and consumer giant reckitt benckiser has just announced that it 's decided to spin off its pharmaceuticals division , suboxone , as a separate company .
more changes , in a sector gripped by takeover fever this year .

ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) glaxo has opened up the possibility of breaking up the company and is open to spinning off consumer healthcare unit as standalone company ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) on a similar note reckitt benckiser is to pursue a demerger of pharmaceuticals unit with a separate uk listing not much in the diary this morning , alas , with little economic news to look forward to , but i 'll be tracking the main developments through the day

Lloyds trader joked: Every Little Helps.
